text: which protobuf version is used in fabric?
its a beta of proto3, we need to upgrade to the release
I opened a Jira issue if anyone wants to investigate upgrading to proto3 <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-108>
<@U0KPFAZNF>: , is the upgrade to 3 100% going to happen?

``` The advantage is that if everyone was required to compile these files, they would always be in sync. The disadvantage is that this requires developers to use Vagrant (it's hard not to already) or requires that they install and use the correct version of protobuf as defined in the Vagrant setup script. ```
Why is that a problem? if a developer messes with the grpc message structure shouldn't he/she go the extra mile and install protobuf locally? we could write the protobuf version as comments in the .proto files or something
ok it compiles well (the project *.proto with proto v3), <@U0TFEHX8E>  can I take this issue? (108)?
